snippet: A bill in Texas would change not only how lawmakers conduct business, but also how often, in a state where legislators meet only in odd-numbered years.
abstract: Texas bill would drastically change how State Legislature conducts business, and how often, by requiring it to meet in regular session in odd-numbered years and to hold budget session in even-numbered years; Texas is one of only four states whose legislatures convene in regular session only every two years, and move is viewed with suspicion in state that prizes small government and deregulation.
lead_paragraph: A bill in Texas would change not only how lawmakers conduct business, but also how often, in a state where legislators meet only in odd-numbered years.

headline.seo: Bill Pushes for More Legislative Sessions in Texas
headline.main: In Texas, Resistance to a Renewed Call for an Annual Roundup of Legislators
